problem.title: CheckPoint: Angular Momentum of Point Masses
problem.script:
from __future__ import division from loncapa import *
#Enter the computations here m = lc_random(0.8, 3.0, 0.1) k = lc_random(180, 320, 1) v = lc_random(0.4, 0.8, 0.05) d = 0.3
vmax = math.sqrt(( m* v* v + k* d* d)/ m) A = math.sqrt(( m* v* v + k* d* d)/ k) vavg = 2*math.sqrt( m* v* v + k* d* d)/(3.14159*math.sqrt( m))
problem.p: A block of mass m = $m kg is vibrating on a spring with a force constant of k = $k N/m. When the instantaneous speed of the block is v = $v m/s, the block is 0.30 m away from equilibrium.
problem.part:
What is the best concept to use in order to find the maximum speed of the block during the vibrations?
Conservation of Energy
Conservation of Momentum
Kinematics of Simple Harmonic Motion
Kinematics of Motion with Constant Acceleration
Newton's 2nd law
Find the maximum speed of the block during the vibrations.

What is the best concept to use in order to find the amplitude of vibrations?
Conservation of Energy
Conservation of Momentum
Kinematics of Simple Harmonic Motion
Kinematics of Motion with Constant Acceleration
Newton's 2nd law
Find the average speed of the block during one period of oscillations.
